title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Decision on environmental clearance deferred for ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel's plant in Andhra Pradesh
Lumax Auto Technologies’ Q2 profit rises 56% to ₹67 crore
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- LATL reported consolidated profit attributable to owners of *₹67 crore* for the quarter ended September 2025, up *56% YoY* from ₹43 crore. 
- Revenue from operations rose *37% YoY* to *₹1,156 crore*, with a sequential rise of *13%* to ₹1,026 crore. 
- The board approved the re-appointment of *Dhanesh Kumar Jain* as Executive Chairman and *Anmol Jain* as MD, plus an amalgamation with *IAC International Automotive India Pvt Ltd* and a ₹5 crore investment in *Lumax Resources Pvt Ltd* via optionally convertible redeemable debentures.

items.title: BirlaNu targets ₹1,000-crore construction chemicals push via ₹120-crore Clean Coats buyout
Rishiroop to invest ₹35 crore for capacity expansion
items.summary:
- *Rishiroop Limited* board approves about *₹35 crore* investment to expand capacity and diversify into *plastics compounding*, targeting a high-growth segment. 
- The plan includes a new line of business with an estimated *₹17 crore*; capacity expansion of 1,000 MT to reach *2,500 MT* funded by *₹18 crore*, to be completed in 12 months via internal accruals. 
- Rationale focuses on modernization, capacity enhancement, and replacement of ageing machinery.

items.title: Elista sets sights on global markets with export-oriented Kadapa smart factory
Saatvik Green Energy arm bags ₹299 crore solar module orders
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - Saatvik Green Energy's material subsidiary, **Saatvik Solar Industries**, has received and accepted new orders worth **₹299.40 crore** for **solar photovoltaic modules** from three independent power producers and EPC players, to be executed between December 2025 and March 2026. - These repeat orders bolster the order book as the company expands; Saatvik is setting up a **4.8 GW** solar module facility at **Ambala, Haryana**, and an integrated **4 GW module and 4.8 GW solar cell** greenfield facility in **Odisha** to support India's **solar manufacturing**. - CEO **Prashant Mathur** says bankable partners with dependable supply chains are critical as India accelerates its **renewable energy** deployment, underpinning the company's growth trajectory.

items.title: Panasonic to return to Japanese leadership as India chairman Manish Sharma steps down
GST rate cut eases discount pressure for truck makers
items.author: G Balachandar
items.summary: - **GST rate cut** and rationalisation lowered base prices and eased discount pressure in the *M&HCV* truck market. - Before the cut, discounts on ~₹50 lakh M&HCVs were up to ₹5 lakh (~10%), but post-cut discounts fell to about **2%** of the sticker price. - Many observers call the discount drop *temporary*, with dealers noting pricing remains competitive and the net customer cost changing only marginally.

items.title: Emmvee Photovoltaic bets on India's solar boom with $625m capex
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- IPO-bound Emmvee Photovoltaic plans about *55 billion rupees* (**$625m**) to expand module and cell manufacturing capacity.
- Module capacity would grow from 7.8 GW to 16.3 GW by H1 2028 and cell capacity from 2.94 GW to 8.94 GW, funded by **60% debt** and **40% equity**.
- The expansion supports India's target of *500 GW non-fossil capacity by 2030*, amid **US tariffs** concerns and a focus on the domestic market.

items.title: Qcells furloughs 1,000 US workers over stalled shipments
items.summary:
- *Qcells* furloughed about 1,000 workers at its Georgia plants due to routinely stalled shipments from overseas and customs delays.
- The slowdown follows shipments of solar cells detained at US ports under the 2021 Xinjiang-related import ban, prompting production cuts and reduced hours.
- Qcells plans to invest $2.5 billion to build a complete US solar supply chain and expand US cell manufacturing in Cartersville, Georgia.

items.title: UVZ to restructure to cut costs, says Reuters
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- **UVZ** said it is restructuring to optimise administrative and management expenses to cut costs.
- Local media reported up to **10%** staff cuts by February, with some workers moved to a four-day work week.
- The Nizhny Tagil plant, maker of the **T-90M** and upgrading **T-72B3M**, continues to fulfil a state defence order and keep hiring.

items.title: Decision on environmental clearance deferred for ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel's plant in Andhra Pradesh
India should attract Chinese firms to manufacture here
items.author: Shrishti Sharma
items.summary: - *Investment-led strategies* to cut dependence on China by inviting foreign firms to relocate manufacturing to India, as with **Apple**.\n- Import substitution alone won't suffice; incentives under the **China Plus One** framework are needed to attract multinationals.\n- This could strengthen India's role in global value chains and boost domestic value addition, highlighted by **Apple**'s India expansion.

items.title: Rajasthan's largest solar park with storage in Bikaner
items.summary: - *Pugal Solar Park* in *Bikaner* will combine *2,450MW solar* with *5,000MWh BESS*, touted as the nation's largest solar-plus-storage facility.\n- Spanning 4,353 hectares, it is developed by *RSDCL*, a subsidiary of *RRECL*, with plug-and-play infrastructure and assured grid connectivity.\n- The project aims to attract over ₹18,000 crore in investment, with a 25-year PPA framework and a tender planned for Nov 28, 2025.

items.title: CIL-DVC to expand 1,600 MW thermal project in Jharkhand
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- State-owned *Coal India Ltd* (CIL) and *Damodar Valley Corporation* (DVC) will expand a ₹21,000 crore thermal project in *Jharkhand* at Chandrapura.
- The plan envisions two *800 MW* ultra-supercritical units (1,600 MW total) with **50:50** equity, and coal supplied by *Central Coalfields Ltd.*
- It aims to strengthen baseload capacity, target commercial operation by 2031-32, and explore future joint *renewable energy projects*.

items.title: CONCOR awards ₹461.55 cr in wagon contracts
items.summary:
- **CONCOR** awarded about **₹461.55 crore** in wagon leasing and equipment-supply contracts to Touax Texmaco Railcar Leasing Pvt. Ltd., TIL Ltd., and **GATX India Pvt. Ltd.** to expand rail logistics capacity. 
- **Touax Texmaco Railcar Leasing Pvt. Ltd.** received ₹157.92 crore for eight rakes of *BLSS wagons* with Brake Van Type **BVCM** on a 10-year operating lease, with delivery within 255 days. 
- **TIL Ltd.** won ₹66.75 crore for 25 loaded reach stackers (delivery in 330 days) and **GATX India Pvt. Ltd.** was awarded ₹236.88 crore for 12 rakes of *BLSS wagons* on a 10-year lease (delivery in 315 days).

items.title: Nexperia chip shipments resume as Germany de-escalates
items.summary:
- *Nexperia* has resumed some chip shipments as de-escalation signs emerge between the Netherlands and China.
- German officials and auto suppliers like *Aumovio* and *Honda* report movement, aided by exemptions on *Chinese export controls*.
- *Nexperia* could not confirm a restart, but executives expect the flow of products to resume soon, with production at affected sites slated for next week.

items.title: Sitharaman visits Tata semiconductor plant in Assam
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- *Sitharaman* visited Tata Group's ₹27,000 crore semiconductor plant in Morigaon, Assam, signaling a push toward a self-sufficient *chip manufacturing* ecosystem.
- She reviewed Tata Electronics' OSAT facility in Jagiroad and stressed the drive for **high-tech manufacturing** and regional jobs, underscoring *North-East* development.
- The day also featured inaugurations in Guwahati, including the *Gateway of Guwahati* and the Brahmaputra Riverfront, with plans to lay the foundation stone for Swahid Kanaklata Barua State University.

items.title: Asian Energy bags ₹459-cr CHP order in Odisha
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *₹459-crore contract* from *Mahanadi Coalfields Limited* to Asian Energy Services (with JV) for a *coal handling plant* in *Odisha*, covering end-to-end turnkey execution from design to O&M.
- This is the company’s largest CHP order to date, boosting its order book beyond *₹2,000 crore* and strengthening its mining and coal-handling footprint.
- The scope includes pre-engineered turnkey work: design, supply, erection, commissioning, trial runs, testing, and O&M during the defect liability period, with a seven-year timeline.

items.title: Tata Power completes second ₹830cr tranche in Bhutan hydro
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- Tata Power completed the second tranche of its proposed investment, infusing *₹60 crore* for a *40% stake* in KHPL.
- KHPL is developing the *600 MW Khorlochhu Hydropower Project* in Bhutan, with a project cost of *₹6,900 crore*.
- The total investment of about *₹830 crore* will be disbursed over five years and supports Bhutan’s *clean energy transition*.

items.title: Vedanta expands Restora at BALCO Korba plant
items.summary:
- *Vedanta Aluminium* expands its **low-carbon portfolio** by launching *Restora production* at BALCO Korba plant in Chhattisgarh, using renewable energy. 
- The **Restora** line delivers low-emission aluminium with **GHG intensity** below 4 t CO2e per tonne, aligning with global standards for *low-carbon aluminium*, and includes *Restora Ultra* variants from recovered aluminium. 
- Executives say the move strengthens India's role as a climate-conscious manufacturing hub and enables customers to build greener value chains.

items.title: Elon Musk wants to build a ‘gigantic’ chip fab to fuel Tesla’s AI revolution
Britannia sees GST reset to shift market share in favour of bigger FMCG firms
Horizon Industrial Parks appoints Urvish Rambhia as CEO
items.summary:
- **Horizon Industrial Parks** appoints *Urvish Rambhia* as Chief Executive Officer to drive growth and partner with **Blackstone**.
- Rambhia joins from **Blackstone**’s India Real Estate team, where he led investments in data centres and logistics to strengthen Horizon’s platform.
- Established in 2022, Horizon now spans 42 parks across 10 markets with 53 million sq ft of leasable area, a leading Grade A industrial/logistics developer in India.

items.title: Godrej Enterprises Group earns Water Positive cert
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Godrej Enterprises Group has earned the *Water Positive certification* from **TÜV India** after a third-party audit covering all 25 plants in India.
- The group reports a Water Positive Index of **1.87**, replenishing 1.87 litres of water for every litre consumed.
- The endorsement confirms that its *water management practices* drive regenerative outcomes beyond compliance, backed by transparent data and measurable results.

items.title: Axiscades–MBDA expand defence tie-up for localisation
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The expanded test bench facility at Axiscades’ Aeroland campus will support mass production of advanced test benches for *MBDA*’s missile and launcher platforms. 
- Axiscades is creating a dedicated *MBDA* system integration centre at the Devanahalli Atmanirbhar Cluster and a future Missile Atmanirbhar Complex in Hyderabad to boost localisation and *Make in India*. 
- Florent Duleux of MBDA says the expansion strengthens *Make in India* objectives and MBDA’s global operations, while Sampath Ravinarayanan of Axiscades emphasizes growing *indigenous* missile production.

items.title: Uno Minda Q2 net profit up 21% to ₹322.8 crore
items.summary:
- **Net profit up 21% YoY to ₹322.79 crore** for Q2FY26, aided by higher sales across key segments.
- Revenue from operations rose to ₹4,814 crore from ₹4,245 crore, driven by demand from passenger vehicle and two-wheeler OEMs.
- EBITDA rose 14% to ₹551 crore, with margins steady around 11.5%.

items.title: Vedanta launches CopperTech Metals to run KCM in Zambia
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *CopperTech Metals* will own and operate *Konkola Copper Mines (KCM)* in Zambia, expanding Vedanta's copper footprint.
- The project targets raising annual integrated copper production from 140,000 tonnes in FY26 to 300,000 tonnes by 2031, with a long-term goal of 500,000 tonnes.
- A $1.5 billion programme will boost production and efficiency using *AI-driven exploration and extraction technology*, with logistics support from the US-backed *Lobito Corridor*.

items.title: Nvidia CEO: No active talks on Blackwell sale to China
items.summary:
- *Jensen Huang* said there are 'no active discussions' on selling Nvidia's flagship *Blackwell* AI chip to *China*. 
- The Blackwell chip remains restricted due to U.S. concerns over military and domestic AI use in China. 
- Huang noted that China would need to change its policy; during his Taiwan visit he praised *TSMC* and cited limited U.S. sales like the H20, with China's share of advanced AI chips effectively zero.

items.title: Uno Minda Q2 net profit rises 21% to ₹323 crore; revenue up 13%
items.summary:
- Uno Minda reported a *21% YoY* rise in consolidated *net profit* to ₹322.79 crore for Q2FY26, aided by higher sales across key segments.
- *Revenue from operations* rose to ₹4,814 crore, up from ₹4,245 crore, driven by strong demand from passenger vehicle and two‑wheeler OEMs.
- EBITDA climbed 14% to ₹551 crore with margins steady at *11.5%*, as the company expands capacity in *lighting systems*, *switches*, and *sensors* to boost OEM partnerships and EV adoption.

items.title: Saatvik Green Energy bags ₹299 crore solar module orders
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- Saatvik Solar Industries has secured new orders worth **₹299.40 crore** for solar photovoltaic modules from three independent power producers and EPC players. 
- The repeat orders will be executed between **December 2025 and March 2026**, aligning with project timelines and underpinning the company’s expansion of a **4.8 GW Ambala facility** and a **4 GW/4.8 GW Odisha greenfield** site. 
- CEO Prashant Mathur says bankable partners with dependable supply chains are critical as India scales renewable energy deployment.

items.title: Forging India’s future: How manufacturing and mining are powering economic growth and self-reliance
Hindalco’s Q2 FY26 profit rises 21% to ₹4,741 crore
Malaysia's manufacturing jobs hit 2.4 million in September: DOSM
items.summary:
- *Malaysia's manufacturing employment* reached *2.4 million* in *September 2025*, up *1.0% YoY* and *0.5% MoM*, showing ongoing hiring momentum across major sub-sectors.
- *Wages* rose as total salaries and wages increased *2.0%* to *RM8.4 billion* and average wages per employee rose *1.1%* to *RM3,479*.
- In *Q3 2025*, manufacturing sales climbed to *RM500.1 billion* (+*3.5%*), with January–September sales reaching *RM1.5 trillion* (+*3.6%*), signalling stable labour absorption and wage growth amid moderating expansion.

items.title: DGT partners with Autodesk to upskill ITI and NSTI faculty nationwide
AVP Infracon bags ₹78.75 cr orders
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- AVP Infracon won *₹78.75 crore* in *highway* and *industrial* projects. 
- The highway order of *₹57.57 crore* will widen the *Thiruvannamalai–Thiyagadurgam Road* from two to four lanes, due in 12 months. 
- Two industrial orders from *Reliance Mappedu Multi Modal Logistics Park* total *₹21.18 crore* (₹12.77 cr internal roads + ₹8.41 cr RCC drain/OSBL), due in three months.

items.title: Welspun wins ₹3,145cr Panjrapur WTP contract
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Welspun Enterprises wins a contract worth about **₹3,145 crore** from the **Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation** to design, build, and operate a **910 MLD** water treatment plant at **Panjrapur**, Maharashtra.
- The scope covers **civil, mechanical, electrical, and instrumentation works** with an O&M component of **₹1,156 crore**, to be completed in **48 months** followed by **15 years** of O&M.
- Welspun has partnered with **Veolia** for technology, with the project aimed at meeting Mumbai's water demand and providing around **70%** of the city's freshwater after completion (alongside the 2,000 MLD Bhandup plant).

items.title: Haryana CM invites Tesla to set up plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini invites **Tesla** to set up a manufacturing facility, promising government support to promote EVs and investment. 
- He highlighted the **Haryana Electric Vehicle Policy** with incentives, infrastructure, and a pro-business climate to accelerate EV adoption. 
- Isabelle Fan of **Tesla** invited the CM to inaugurate India's first integrated Tesla Center in Gurugram on Nov 27, including an experience centre and supercharging.

items.title: Mangalam Worldwide sets sight on global expansion and industry diversification
Maharashtra, GSC Group seal ₹8,000 crore pumped hydro deal
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- The Maharashtra government and Singapore’s *GSC Group* signed an **₹8,000 crore MoU** for a 1,500 MW *Pumped Storage Hydroelectric Project* in Dhule and Nandurbar.
- The project is *GSC Group’s* third such venture in India, expected to create about 2,500 jobs and generate over **₹1,100 crore** yearly revenue.
- Officials say fast-track clearances will help reach ~70,315 MW of pumped storage and attract **₹3.83 lakh crore** in investments across MoUs.

items.title: BHEL secures ₹6,650 crore order from NTPC for 800 MW Darlipali supercritical power project
Divi's Laboratories Q2 profit rises 35% to ₹689 crore
items.summary:
- Divi's Laboratories reported a consolidated PAT of *₹689 crore* for Q2 FY26 (quarter ended Sept 30, 2025), up *35%* year over year on robust growth across its *core businesses*.
- Revenue from operations rose *16% YoY* to *₹2,715 crore*, with total income at *₹2,860 crore* (including *₹145 crore* other income) and a sequential gain of *13%* from Q1 FY26.
- PBT climbed to *₹912 crore* and the quarter showed a foreign exchange gain of *₹63 crore*, while H1 FY26 total income stood at *₹5,389 crore* with PAT of *₹1,234 crore*.

items.title: Drugmaker AstraZeneca profit jumps as US business grows
items.summary:
- AstraZeneca's Q3 net profit jumped *77%* to *$2.53 billion*, driven by strong oncology sales.
- Group revenue grew *12%* to *$15.2 billion*, with oncology powering growth and a push to expand its US manufacturing footprint.
- CEO Pascal Soriot said the US strategy is central, citing a historic deal to lower American drug prices and plans to invest about *$50 billion* in US manufacturing and R&D by 2030.

items.title: Cummins India logs 42% rise in Q2 net profit to ₹638 crore
items.summary:
- Cummins India Ltd reported a **42%** rise in Q2 net profit to **₹638 crore** for the quarter ended September 30. 
- Total sales rose **28%** to **₹3,122 crore**, with domestic sales at **₹2,577 crore** (+28% YoY, +10% sequential) and exports at **₹545 crore** (+24% YoY, +4% QoQ). 
- Management cited steady demand and **operational efficiency** as growth drivers, with a cautiously optimistic outlook for domestic and international markets.

items.title: US blocks Nvidia sale of scaled-down AI chips to China
items.summary:
- The *White House* blocked Nvidia from selling its scaled-down **B30A** AI chips to China, per *The Information*.
- Nvidia reportedly provided samples to Chinese customers, while Beijing's rules require only domestically developed chips for state-funded data centers.
- Nvidia says it has *zero share* in China's datacenter market and is pursuing design changes as export controls and regulatory headwinds persist.

items.title: Iron ore set for weekly loss amid soft steel demand
items.summary:
- *Iron ore futures* fell as *steel demand* in China weakened and production cuts weighed on prices.
- The most-traded January iron ore on the Dalian Exchange slid 1.16% to 766 yuan/ton, while the Singapore benchmark declined about 1.8% to $102.05/ton, for a weekly drop near 3.95%.
- *Analysts* say China’s steel overcapacity crackdown and soft demand across real estate and manufacturing point to a bearish near-term outlook into Q4.

items.title: AI-led productivity headroom in India
items.summary:
- In *India*, the headroom for *AI*-driven productivity is higher than in many nations, according to **S Krishnan**.
- Globally, about 70% use AI for entertainment, but in *India* it’s used more for business and enterprise purposes.
- The **Business Software Alliance** and partners have called for an India-wide agenda to adopt enterprise *AI*, including easing cross-border data transfers and access to non-sensitive government datasets.

items.title: Musk: Tesla mega AI chip fab, Intel talks
items.summary: - Musk says Tesla may have to build a *gigantic chip fab* to mass‑produce AI chips. - He floated **Intel** as a potential partner, but no deal has been signed yet. - AI5 will start with limited production in 2026 and AI6 could reach higher volume and ~2x performance by mid‑2028.

items.title: Akamai sees Q4 sales above estimates on AI demand
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Akamai forecasts Q4 revenue of about $1.07–$1.09 billion, driven by strong *AI* demand and its *content delivery network* offerings.
- Shares rose nearly *6%* in after-hours trading as the company narrowed its full-year revenue range.
- Its *AI* and cloud infrastructure strength helped post a Q3 revenue beat and underscored Akamai's resilience as rivals like Netflix and Apple expand their own **CDN** networks.

items.title: Chips are down for handset companies amid AI boom
